header.h1: Watch Neil Diamond perform ‘Sweet Caroline’ with COVID-19 tips: ‘Hands … washing hands’

figcaption.p: Neil Diamond performs an altered version of "Sweet Caroline" from home. He added tips to fight the coronavirus to the lyrics.

div.data-title: Watch Neil Diamond perform ‘Sweet Caroline’ with COVID-19 tips: ‘Hands … washing hands’

div.p: Neil Diamond has put a new spin to a classic in the fight against the coronavirus pandemic.
On Saturday, a video of the 79-year-old singer performing “Sweet Caroline” was posted to social media and featured tips on hot to battle COVID-19.

“I know we’re going through a rough time right now, but I love you, and I think maybe if we sing together we might feel a little bit better,” Diamond said before performing in his home next to a fire with his dog.
The updated version of “Sweet Caroline” features the following lyrics:
“Hands, washing hands, reaching out, don’t touch me, I won’t touch you.”

div.blockquote: Stay safe out there! “Hands... washing hands..” 🎶 pic.twitter.com/QaRB1qZshp— Neil Diamond (@NeilDiamond) March 22, 2020

div.p: The video has more than a million views, been liked more than 42,000 times on Facebook and shared more than 55,000 times. Meanwhile, over on Twitter, it has gotten more than 12,000 re-tweets and 28,000 likes.
The song has been played at Boston’s Fenway Park, home of Major League Baseball’s Red Sox, for years in the middle of the eighth inning.
In 2018, Diamond announced his retirement after being diagnosed with Parkinson’s disease.

Follow our COVID-19 live updates. Find all of our coronavirus stories. A continuously updated vital information post. A free text-messaging service so you can receive the most urgent coronavirus updates on your cellphone. And ask questions. To sign up, subscribe to Alabama Coronavirus Urgent Alerts. A new weekday newsletter is available. You can subscribe here. Also, download our mobile app where you can receive on-the-go notifications.

p.i: Mark Heim is a sports reporter for The Alabama Media Group. Follow him on Twitter @Mark_Heim.

article.p: Note to readers: if you purchase something through one of our affiliate links we may earn a commission.
